---
title: "Practical Bash Scripting Crash Course"
---

This course will focus on **scripting concepts** rather than basic command-line usage.

---

## Course Outline

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    PRACTICAL BASH SCRIPTING                             │
│                        Crash Course                                     │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Module 1: FOUNDATIONS
├── 1.1  Bash vs Zsh: Key Differences
├── 1.2  Script Structure & Shebang
├── 1.3  Running Scripts & Permissions
└── 1.4  Comments & Style Conventions

Module 2: VARIABLES & DATA
├── 2.1  Variable Declaration & Assignment
├── 2.2  Environment vs Local Variables
├── 2.3  Special Variables ($0, $1, $?, $$, etc.)
├── 2.4  Arrays (Indexed & Associative)
└── 2.5  String Manipulation

Module 3: INPUT & OUTPUT
├── 3.1  echo vs printf
├── 3.2  Reading User Input (read)
├── 3.3  Command Substitution
├── 3.4  Redirection (>, >>, <, 2>&1)
└── 3.5  Pipes and Process Substitution

Module 4: CONTROL FLOW
├── 4.1  Conditionals (if/elif/else)
├── 4.2  Test Expressions ([ ], [[ ]], (( )))
├── 4.3  Case Statements
├── 4.4  Loops (for, while, until)
└── 4.5  Loop Control (break, continue)

Module 5: FUNCTIONS
├── 5.1  Defining & Calling Functions
├── 5.2  Arguments & Return Values
├── 5.3  Local Variables & Scope
└── 5.4  Useful Patterns (error handling, logging)

Module 6: TEXT PROCESSING
├── 6.1  grep, sed, awk Basics
├── 6.2  cut, sort, uniq, tr
├── 6.3  Regular Expressions in Bash
└── 6.4  Processing CSV/TSV Files

Module 7: FILE & DIRECTORY OPERATIONS
├── 7.1  File Tests (-f, -d, -e, -r, etc.)
├── 7.2  Globbing & Pattern Matching
├── 7.3  find & xargs
└── 7.4  Batch File Processing

Module 8: PRACTICAL PATTERNS
├── 8.1  Argument Parsing (getopts)
├── 8.2  Error Handling & Exit Codes
├── 8.3  Signal Trapping (trap)
├── 8.4  Debugging Techniques (set -x, -e, -u)
└── 8.5  Script Templates & Best Practices

Module 9: REAL-WORLD PROJECTS
├── 9.1  Automation Script (backup, cleanup)
├── 9.2  Data Processing Pipeline
├── 9.3  DICOM/Medical Imaging Workflow Helper
└── 9.4  Deployment & Cron Jobs
```

---

## How We'll Learn

| Approach | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| **Concept** | Brief explanation with ASCII diagrams |
| **Example** | Working code snippets |
| **Practice** | Mini-exercises to try |
| **Project** | Real-world application |
